title: Unresponsive Clicking - Any and all help welcome
body:
I am fairly new to League. I have played for about a month with no problem until about a week ago. I got into a game and was unable to click anything. I could not move, open the shop, etc. My clicks were unresponsive. I could still stand there and watch the game go on and chat with teammates, but simply could not click anything. This has happened in every game I have entered since. (not a mouse problem)
I just reinstalled league for the 3rd time with no luck, and have ran the repair tool countless times.

I am running Windows 7, Service Pack 1. A few times (I think most if not every time has been straight after reinstalling) I have gotten a message stating that League will no longer support Windows XP Service Pack 2 after June 1, 2016 and that my computer uses Service Pack 2. This is strange because 1) I do not run Windows XP Service Pack 2, and 2) Its long past June 1st, and i had no problems up until recently.

idk if the service pack thing has anything to do with this but i figured it was worth noting.
I made a similar post a few days ago but received no help. Any suggestions would be GREATLY appreciated.
Thank you very much.

replies.body:
It's important to get your Windows updated to prevent issues or interruptions, but I'm not sure if that's causing your unresponsive inputs.  You could also have a corrupt config, which can happen especially if manual modifications are made.  To be sure, try resetting your configuration folder but keep in mind you'll need redo your bindings:

 **Log into the game** then hop into **a custom game**. *Alt+Tab* out of the match, then navigate to your League installation folder, which should be in C:\Riot Games\League of Legends

Delete the folder named **Config**

Once you've deleted the folder, leave the custom match. You'll then want to hop into another custom match to confirm the changes were saved.

I hope that helps!
